test-set.name: output
test-set.description: Tests the xsl:output declaration, and hence serialization generally

source.description: An XML/HTML tree containing prefixed elements in SVG, MathML and a foreign namespace
An XML/HTML tree containing prefixed attributes in SVG, MathML and a foreign namespace

test-case.name: output-0101
test-case.description: Test escaping of non-ASCII characters in HTML output when @escape-uri-attributes= yes.

test-case.description: Test escaping of non-ASCII characters in HTML output when @escape-uri-attributes="true".

test-case.name: output-0117
test-case.description: Boolean attributes should not be output in minimized form.

test-case.name: output-0118
test-case.description: Processing instructions should be terminated with "?>". Output method is XHTML.

test-case.name: output-0119
test-case.description: Simple test of XHTML output with @indent=no

modified.change: Alternative result if default html-version is 5.0

test-case.name: output-0120
test-case.description: Test of cdata-section-elements processing. <example> should not be processed.

test-case.name: output-0121
test-case.description: Test that the default value of @omit-xml-declaration with XHTML output method is 'no'.

test-case.name: output-0122
test-case.description: All xsl:output elements are merged into a single element. While repeats of most attributes are just tested for conflicts, cdata-section-elements will contain the union of the specified values. Both example and test should be wrapped by CDATA, and the output should be XML (since cdata-section-elements only applies to XML).

test-case.name: output-0123
test-case.description: Test HTML output with default value for @include-content-type, the result tree has a 'head' element. (default is 'yes')

test-case.description: Test HTML output with include-content-type=yes, the result tree has a 'head' element.

test-case.description: Test XHTML output with default value for @include-content-type, the result tree has a 'head' element in the XHTML namespace and '@media-type="application/xhtml-xml".

test-case.name: output-0127
test-case.description: Test XHTML output with include-content-type=no. The document element of the final result tree is 'html' in the XHTML namespace.

modified.change: Alternative result if default html-version is 5.0

all-of.serialization-matches: <head>the head</head><body>this should not have a meta tag</body></html>

test-case.name: output-0128
test-case.description: Test XML output DOES NOT output a meta tag when include-content-type is specified and head element is present

test-case.description: Test Text output DOES NOT output a meta tag when include-content-type is specified and head element is present

test-case.description: Test with no output method explicitly specified and the document element of the implicit result tree is html in the XHTML namespace. Show to output method defaults to XHTML.

test-case.name: output-0173
test-case.description: Test of merging two unnamed output declarations with non-overlapping attributes. (output method is XML)

test-case.name: output-0174
test-case.description: Test of merging two named output declarations with non-overlapping attributes.

test-case.name: output-0175
test-case.description: Test with two named output declarations with the same name and the same import precedence and different values for the same attributes, then a third output declaration with the same name but with higher precedence which sets values for the conflicting attributes. Show that there is no conflict and the third named output declaration is used.

test-case.name: output-0178
test-case.description: Test with unsupported value for @encoding, output method is XHTML. Two alternative results, since the serializer is allowed to report the error or recover by using a different encoding.

test-case.name: output-0180
test-case.description: Test with unsupported value for @encoding, output method is XML. Two alternative results, since the serializer is allowed to report the error or recover by using a different encoding.

test-case.name: output-0182
test-case.description: Test that an error is raised if @standalone value is other than omit and the instance of the data model contains multiple elements children of the root node.

test-case.name: output-0183
test-case.description: Test that an error is raised if @doctype-system is specified and the instance of the data model contains multiple elements children of the root node.

test-case.name: output-0184
test-case.description: Test that an error is raised if the value of @encoding in output method HTML is not supported.

test-case.name: output-0185
test-case.description: Test that an error is raised if the value of @encoding in output method TEXT is not supported.

test-case.name: output-0186
test-case.description: Test that an error is raised if @omit-xml-declarations="yes" in xsl:output and @standalone is other than 'omit'.

test-case.name: output-0187
test-case.description: Test that an error is raised if @omit-xml-declarations="yes" in xsl:output and @version is other than '1.0' and @doctype-system is specified.

test-case.name: output-0188
test-case.description: Test that an error is raised when in xsl:output @method="xml", @undeclare-prefixes="yes", and @version="1.0"

test-case.name: output-0189
test-case.description: Test that an error is raised if the value of @normalization-form in output method XML is not supported by the serializer.

test-case.name: output-0190
test-case.description: Test that an error is raised if the value of @normalization-form in output method XHTML is not supported by the serializer.

test-case.name: output-0191
test-case.description: Test that an error is raised if the value of @normalization-form in output method HTML is not supported by the serializer.

test-case.name: output-0192
test-case.description: Test that an error is raised if the value of @normalization-form in output method TEXT is not supported by the serializer.

test-case.name: output-0193
test-case.description: Test that an error is raised if @normalization-form="fully-normalized" and the result begins with a combining character.

test-case.name: output-0194
test-case.description: Test that an error is raised if in xsl:output @method="html" and the value of @version is not supported by the serializer.

test-case.name: output-0195
test-case.description: Test that an error is raised if the output method is HTML and the result tree contains characters in the #x7F-#x9F range.

modified.change: Declared requirement for HTML serialization version less than 5.0

test-case.name: output-0195a
test-case.description: Test that no error is raised if the output method is HTML, with default version 5.0, and the result tree contains characters in the #x7F-#x9F range.

test-case.name: output-0195b
test-case.description: Test that no error is raised if the output method is HTML, version 5.0, and the result tree contains characters in the #x7F-#x9F range.

test-case.name: output-0196
test-case.description: Test that an error is raised if the output method is HTML and > appears within a processing instruction in the result tree.

test-case.name: output-0197
test-case.description: Test that an error is raised on invalid @byte-order-mark value in xsl:output.

modified.change: spec value to XSLT20 only, see test output-0197a

test-case.description: Test that an error is raised on invalid @byte-order-mark value ("TRUE") in xsl:output.

test-case.description: Test that an error is raised on invalid @escape-uri-attributes value in xsl:output.

test-case.description: Test that an error is raised on invalid @include-content-type value in xsl:output.

test-case.name: output-0601

modified.change: HTML5 serialization is not defined in XSLT 2.0

test-case.name: output-0602a
test-case.description:
HTML5 svg element, unprefixed.
MHK comments 2019-04-11:
The second assertion against the test results implies that the namespace declaration of the svg namespace should not be present on the body element. Saxon 9.9 passes this test, but it's not clear that there is anything in the spec to justify removing the namespace declaration. The spec for *XHTML* serialization is quite clear that the namespace should be removed (the definition of 'prefix normalization' states clearly that "Any namespace node for any of those three namespaces that was previously present on any element node in the instance of the data model is also removed"). But the rules for the *HTML* method are far less clear. For a start, the relevant rules are under a paragraph that starts "If the element is to be serialized as an HTML element, but the local part of the expanded QName is not recognized as the name of an HTML element..." which could imply that the rules do not apply to the body element (but the rules don't actually make much sense under that interpretation). There doesn't seem to be any reading of the rules that causes the svg namespace declaration to be removed from the body element. Also, rules 1 and 2 seem directly contradictory.
Because the rules are so unclear, and because I can't see any reason why the HTML and XHTML rules should differ in such details, I'm going to treat the test results as definitive and the spec as inadequate. Specifically, I think it's much simpler if the HTML output method performs "prefix normalization" for the result tree in exactly the same way as the XHTML output method.

modified.change: HTML5 serialization is not defined in XSLT 2.0
Allow namespace decl on svg element to follow attributes
